name: mira
text: It's a wonder Beef is as together as he is. I admire that cat.

name: blastradius
text: Little icon of Philippe ... this is the saddest thing.

name: atticusonline
text: nooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo

name: delzhand
text: Damn.  Some strips are just hard to read in the context of a humor website.

name: killerlimpet
text: yeah this and the Drew Weing guest strip are a little much for me

name: sabalpalm
text: "Its not humor its character development"

name: spinynorman
text:
Man.

Corliss and Darryl Kazenzakis, and their "son" Cassandra.

When you have handles such as these you are pretty much guaranteeing that the train will derail before it's out of the station.

name: deusoma
text: Don't forget Cassandra's brother, Michael "Showbiz" Kazenzakis.

name: lawbot
text: Do you think that these names are inspired by the Outsiders?

name: spinynorman
text:
I don't know, but I do think that Beef's life has the makings of a shitty Johnny Cash-knock off murder ballad in there.

The ballad will not address that "Cassandra" is a dude.

name: the_stoned_one
text:
"Boy Named Cassandra" just doesn't have the ring like "Boy Named Sue" does.
Cassandra is harder to rhyme.

name: jhunter
text:
blander
coriander
belt-sander
the permutations are far from limitless

name: goatmasterflash
text:
Blander, coriander, and belt-sander do all rhyme with one another, but what's that got to do with "Cassandra"?

Country music is far too literal to deal in slant-rhyme.

name: jhunter
text: I ain't not no Johnny Cash.

name: boredom_man
text:
Before you typecast country rhymes
You should listen to more John Prine.

name: goatmasterflash
text: I love John Prine. He's among my favorite folk/bluegrass musicians.

name: boredom_man
text:
I'm warning you. I am prepared to write 10000 words on why John Prine can be legitimately classified as country in addition to, or even rather than, bluegrass.

I am prepared.

name: goatmasterflash
text: The threat of a scholarly 10,000 word treatise on the distinguishing characteristics of country music is an effective one. Rather than delve into that, I'll just back down now.

name: boredom_man
text: I didn't actually threaten scholarship , but I assure you, it would be bad nonetheless.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
I was a low-down, batshit drunk meanderah.
All cause mom named me Cassandra.

name: tripperday
text: "Far from limitless" is how I'm going to start describing a person's positive virtues to their face just to see if they're smart enough to be insulted.

name: broahsaurus
text: I see this and the first thing I want to do is rhyme Cassandra with Philand'rer.

name: tangles
text: it's humorous AND character development! tell me the awkward pause followed by ray's attempt at comforting beef didn't elicit a giggle

name: boredom_man
text: Right? Personally, I laughed so hard I vomited blood.

name: rowboat
text: This is about as close to an intersection of Onstad and Chris Ware that I'd ever want to be. Makes me wanna just hide under the covers and think happy thoughts - like Phillipe standing on a drum machine manual, or something.

name: yingkaixing
text: So did Chris Ware week give you recurring nightmares?

name: rowboat
text: He gave me tears in my stool.

name: carlyle
text: Tears, as in the crying, or tears, as in the rips?

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aliiis, blastradius, sticks, Daaaaang, Doc_Rostov)

name: craigola
text: I think I know that girl in Canada!

name: ffwhhros12
text: I think I AM that girl in Canada

name: invidious
text: Her name is Alberta she lives in Vancouver!

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
she cooks like my mother and...
yes .

name: red-barchetta
text: I honestly did work with a woman that had I cups. I don't know how she lived with those things.

name: lux
text: How the hell do you lay on your stomach? Overlarge breasts seem to be a great obstacle.

text:
Wait. Wait. Ray is an ass man/boy at this stage, surely...

Something's not right here.

name: saru
text: I'm as ass-man. Doesn't mean I can't appreciate a nice pair-a jugs.

name: straw
text: This is why he suppressed his breast man status for so long.

text: that is tite noticing.

name: tekende
text: Was--was that a Man Who Fell to Earth reference?

name: tekende
text: I don't think I'll ever know for sure. :-(

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i think it's Bruce Almighty..?

name: mangtastic
text:
You mean The Truman Show.

Jim Carey was in both so it is an easy mistake, unless he used that line in more than one movie which means that I do not care that much about Jim Carey movies except for The Truman Show because that one was good.

Also the one where he was Andy Kaufman.

name: nurdbot
text: Jesus. I think this pretty much the heaviest moment of Beefs past we have seen.

name: nabeel84
text: A comment left by nabeel84 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt2, Art-Vader, usversusthem)

name: jesler729
text: Yeah but that was horrific in a kind of sickly funny way. This one is just... jesus.

text: i think that was how he was treated every day.

text: "I killed them with a brick!" -- Damn...stone cold.

name: patkun
text: A comment left by patkun was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt, mygoodfriend, Mangtastic, Pseudochron, yingkaixing, dj)

name: tekende
text: Hm. Mine would probably agree with me, and then the whole evening would just be ruined

name: boredom_man
text: Tekende all huggin' her body singin' free-verse eulogies by Bright Eyes

name: tekende
text:
Thank God that relationship is over

(I miss the boning though)

name: 1000hz
text: I don't know what exactly it is about them, but I just love every one of the Ray and Beef as kids strips so damn much.

name: eric
text: I love how Ray's first thought of consoling his friend is to admit that he told a tall tale regarding a woman's bosom.

name: straw
text: Like a dude who has just heard his dad get shot really cares if the J-cups were real or not.

name: invidious
text: I can't speak for Beef, but based on the relationship I have with my father I would most definitely be more interested in a girl with real J-cups than in his recent homocide.

name: echidnaboy
text: Maybe he's worried they're about to be killed with a brick (or a gun) and he doesn't want the last words they shared to be a lie. Speaking of last words, "TRY ME, BITCH" is right up there with "You don't have the guts to pull that trigger" or "They couldn't hit an elephant at this dist--"

name: cdl146
text: Heavy...

this is a serious circumstance

name: direhaggis
text: Man, Beef's grannie and both of his folks have a nasty streak about them. Occasionally it comes out in Beef, but you can tell the cat hella regrets that business.

text:
heh heh, Hey guys, check it out, this strip has 69 comments!

...oh, dammit.

name: panopticism
text: man this is fucking tragic

name: gigs
text: Why is it always Canada? Even if you're not making it up, if anyone ever mentions some chick from another country during your adolescence, 9 out of 10 times, she's from Canada.

text:
Apparently these are J-cups.

NOTE: NOT SAFE FOR WORK OR FOR PEOPLE WHO EVER WANT TO FEEL OKAY ABOUT THE WORLD AGAIN.

name: i_love_kate
text: There's few things more British than sucking on your own breast and looking decidedly uninterested by the whole endeavour.

name: carlyle
text: BBW ATTEMPTS SEDUCTIVE LOOK

name: gigs
text:
Huh, I would've expected something a little more...

Fucking internet. I can't even enjoy being shocked at J-Cups.

name: dipstikk
text: Those are not J-cups.

name: desert_donkey
text: frame 11.. the look on little ray's face. so amazing. and again, the R. shirt.. the definitive 80's poseur surfer shirt. all kooks wore those. you never saw a real surfer wearing one. very popular with the valley kooks.

name: zapatos
text:
Hell of circumstances yo.

I am not even going to read the rest of the comments, a moment of silence please.

name: chetyre
text: I felt bad about 5'ing this, but it's still a damn good strip.  Man.  You don't always expect something this intense.

text: Did anyone notice that Beef's speech is typed in the same size as everyone else's here?  Very nice touch.
